pattern.name: Change count
pattern.description:
Count of changes of an attribute value in time.
Note: This pattern is different from the count of duplicates - you can have a list of binary values, but still have more than two changes.
NOTE: Transitions from/to NULL are ignored in the sum (because A!=B returns NULL, if at least one value is NULL). This may not be a desirable behaviour. A solution of the problem could be to use following equality test: (A = B) OR (ISNULL(A, B) IS NULL)
NOTE: The ordering by @temporalColumn may not be unique - for example, if @temporalColumn is a date attribute and multiple events happen during a day. Consequently, it may always return slightly different result.
NOTE: Pattern nominal_change was a duplicate -> removed nominal_change.
Note: Does not work on MySQL.
pattern.example: How many times did a student interrupt his studies?
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @base , sum(is_change) AS @columnName FROM ( SELECT @base , (CASE WHEN lag(@column) OVER (PARTITION BY @basePartitionBy ORDER BY @temporalColumn) != @column THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) is_change FROM @propagatedTable ) t GROUP BY @base
